p: Acute lymphadenopathy involving the left and right axillary lymph nodes was observed in AGM1 and AGM2 at 15 DPI, and AGM3 on 12 DPI ( Table 4 and S6 Fig). Potentially clinically significant marked increases or decreases in laboratory values observed in infected animals for at least two days during the study period were: alanine aminotransferase, alkaline phosphatase, aspartate aminotransferase, calcium, creatinine, eosinophils, hematocrit, hemoglobin, lymphocytes, neutrophils, red blood cell count, total bilirubin ( Table 4 and S7 Fig).
